sections.title: Team Foundation
sections.text: A Subjective data source for team foundation.
list: Config fields: collection_url, repo_name, username, password, target_directory
Output: Writes output files to a target directory and emits structured items downstream.

sections.title: Typical workflow
sections.intro: Configure Team Foundation with the connection fields and run it as part of a BrainBoost pipeline.

cards.title: Connect
cards.text: Provide collection_url, repo_name, username, password, target_directory in the connection form.

cards.title: Fetch
cards.text: Run `fetch()` to ingest, transform, or stream data.

cards.title: Consume
cards.text: Use the emitted items in downstream indexing, search, or automation steps.

items.q: What do I need to configure?
items.a: At minimum: collection_url, repo_name, username, password, target_directory. Additional fields may be optional depending on your use case.
Writes output files to a target directory and emits structured items downstream.
Outputs are emitted to downstream subscribers in the BrainBoost pipeline. Some datasources also write artifacts (context files, catalogs, or exports) locally based on your configuration.

sections.title: Ready to use Team Foundation?
sections.text: Add it to your BrainBoost pipeline and start ingesting.
sections.subtext: Run this datasource locally with your own credentials and storage.
